intro: Gouania microcarpa var. novo-hibernica, commonly known as the Hibernian gouania, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish or purplish hue. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
